page.title: 11Names: Chinnor Area
page.content: Joe Malin was reputed to be the last of the Norman family, De Malyn, which lived in the area. Brasses in St Andrew's Church, Chinnor, of 14th and 15th Century date, are said to be those of his ancestors. Several names seen in ancient records are still existent; the Croxfords, Witneys and Saws, amongst others, play a full part in Chinnor village life today. The Civil War in Chinnor and Emmington The Manor House at Emmington-said to have been blown up-was the home of John Hampden's family. This area was a Roundhead stronghold during the Civil War. Just prior to the Battle of Chalgrove, Prince Rupert sacked Chinnor, burning houses and killing at least 50 people. He took 100 prisoners and many cattle.
